item.title: 美国最新打击中国芯片出口后，应用材料公司前景不变
item.description: 芯片设备制造商应用材料公司（Applied Materials）周二表示，不会因美国政府最新出台的对华半导体出口限制措施而改变第一季度的业绩展望。【原文：Chip equipment maker Applied Materials said on Tuesday it was not changing its outlook for the first quarter in response to the U.S. government's latest restrictions on semiconductor exports to China.】

item.title: 风险偏好回升，全球债务突破 320 万亿美元--国际金融协会（IIF
item.description: 一家银行业贸易组织周二发布的报告显示，由于借贷成本下降和风险偏好上升，2024 年前三季度全球债务存量激增超过 12 万亿美元，达到近 323 万亿美元的新纪录。【原文：The world's debt stock surged by over $12 trillion in the first three quarters of 2024 to a fresh record of nearly $323 trillion, thanks to falling borrowing costs and rising risk appetite, a report by a banking trade group showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 独家：消息人士称英特尔 CEO 候选人名单中包括前董事会成员陈立武
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，在这家陷入困境的美国芯片制造商赶走公司老将帕特-盖尔辛格（Pat Gelsinger）之后，英特尔已开始为首席执行官一职筛选一些候选人，其中包括前董事会成员陈立武。【原文：Intel has started shortlisting a handful of candidates, including former board member Lip-Bu Tan, for the role of chief executive after the struggling American chipmaker ousted company veteran Pat Gelsinger, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Humana 称苏珊-戴蒙德将辞去首席财务官一职
item.description: Humana Inc 周二表示，首席财务官 Susan Diamond 将于 1 月 11 日卸任，Celeste Mellet 将接替她的职位。【原文：Humana Inc said on Tuesday that Chief Financial Officer Susan Diamond was stepping down and Celeste Mellet would replace her, effective Jan. 11.】

item.title: 星座品牌将把 Svedka 伏特加出售给 Sazerac，更加专注于优质烈酒领域
item.description: 星座品牌公司（Constellation Brands）周二表示，将把旗下的 Svedka 伏特加出售给总部位于新奥尔良的 Sazerac 公司，因为这家科罗娜啤酒制造商希望把重点放在高端葡萄酒和烈酒业务上。【原文：Constellation Brands said on Tuesday it would sell its Svedka vodka to New Orleans-based Sazerac, as the Corona beer maker looks to focus on its premium wine and spirits business.】

item.title: Meta 称人工智能对今年全球选举的影响不大
item.description: 尽管人们普遍担心人工智能生成技术可能会干扰今年全球各地的重大选举，但该技术对 Meta Platforms 应用程序的影响有限。【原文：Despite widespread concern that generative AI could interfere with major elections around the globe this year, the technology had limited impact across Meta Platforms' apps, the tech company said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国廉价航空公司边疆航空公司将提供头等舱式座椅
item.description: 美国廉价航空公司边疆航空公司（Frontier Airlines）周二表示，该公司将提供头等舱式座位，以吸引愿意多花钱的乘客。【原文：U.S. budget carrier Frontier Airlines said Tuesday it will offer first-class style seating to woo passengers willing to spend more.】

item.title: 加拿大丰业银行利润低于预期，原因是税收和支出增加
item.description: 丰业银行（Bank of Nova Scotia）周二公布的季度利润不及分析师预期，原因是税率上升以及与薪酬和技术相关的支出增加。【原文：Bank of Nova Scotia missed analysts' estimates for quarterly profit on Tuesday, hurt by higher taxes and elevated expenses related to compensation and technology.】

item.title: 英特尔下任首席执行官盖尔辛格将获得高达 1200 万美元的报酬
item.description: 周二的一份监管文件显示，英特尔前首席执行官帕特-盖尔辛格（Pat Gelsinger）在被这家陷入困境的美国芯片制造商解雇后，可能获得高达 1200 万美元的赔偿金。【原文：Intel former CEO Pat Gelsinger could get as much as $12 million as payout, a regulatory filing showed on Tuesday, following his ouster from the struggling U.S. chipmaker.】

item.title: 英国竞争监管机构调查 Blackrock-Preqin 33.2 亿美元交易
item.description: 英国竞争监管机构周二表示，正在考虑资产管理公司贝莱德（BlackRock）以 25.5 亿英镑（32.3 亿美元）收购英国数据公司 Preqin 是否会引发当地市场的竞争问题。【原文：Britain's competition regulator said on Tuesday it was considering whether asset management firm BlackRock's 2.55 billion pound ($3.23 billion) acquisition of UK data firm Preqin would raise competition concerns in the local market.】

item.title: 英特尔首席执行官盖尔辛格去职引发对扭亏计划的质疑
item.description: 英特尔公司首席执行官帕特-盖尔辛格（Pat Gelsinger）的去职，使他在这家陷入困境的芯片制造商的扭亏努力中的作用戛然而止，让华尔街怀疑他雄心勃勃的复兴计划是否会被砍掉。【原文：Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger's removal has put an abrupt end to his role in the struggling chipmaker's turnaround efforts, leaving Wall Street with doubts whether his ambitious revival plan is headed for the chopping block.】

item.title: AT&T 预计在 5G 和光纤扩张的推动下，2027 年的自由现金流将超过 180 亿美元
item.description: AT&T 公司周二表示，预计到 2027 年，其自由现金流将超过 180 亿美元，同时该公司详细介绍了在全美范围内拓展 5G 和光纤服务的三年愿景。【原文：AT&T expects its free cash flow to be more than $18 billion in 2027, the company said on Tuesday as it detailed a three-year vision for the business to expand its 5G and fiber services across the United States.】

item.title: 参议员特德-克鲁兹要求调查欧洲对人工智能政策的影响
item.description: 共和党参议员特德-克鲁兹（Ted Cruz）敦促美国官员调查欧洲政府是否试图不适当地影响美国有关人工智能的法律。【原文：Republican Senator Ted Cruz has urged U.S. officials to investigate whether European governments have tried to unduly influence the country’s laws around artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 早间新闻巴黎沸腾，华尔街创纪录，人民币创 2024 年新低
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）称，通用汽车因尾门解锁问题召回超过 13.2 万辆卡车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周二表示，由于担心尾门意外解锁，通用汽车公司将召回约 132,037 辆卡车。【原文：The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Tuesday that General Motors is recalling about 132,037 trucks due to concerns about tailgates unlatching unexpectedly.】

item.title: 贝莱德将以 120 亿美元收购 HPS Investment，大力推进私人信贷业务
item.description: 贝莱德（BlackRock）周二表示，将以约 120 亿美元的全股票价格收购私人信贷公司 HPS Investment Partners，作为全球最大的资产管理公司，贝莱德正寻求在炙手可热的市场中扩张。【原文：BlackRock will buy private credit firm HPS Investment Partners for about $12 billion in an all-stock deal, the companies said on Tuesday, as the world's largest asset manager seeks to expand in a red-hot market.】

item.title: 微软在英国面临云计算许可证诉讼
item.description: 数以千计的企业使用亚马逊、谷歌和阿里巴巴提供的云计算服务，可能要为使用 Windows Server 软件支付更高的许可费，微软因此在英国面临法律诉讼。【原文：Microsoft faces legal action in Britain over a claim that thousands of businesses using cloud computing services provided by Amazon, Google and Alibaba could be paying higher licence fees to use Windows Server software.】

item.title: 为什么通用汽车会在特朗普 "拯救 "底特律汽车制造商的政策下遭受损失？
item.description: 美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）取消汽车排放限制和燃油效率标准的计划似乎将为通用汽车公司（General Motors）带来福音，该公司是美国领先的全尺寸卡车和 SUV 汽车制造商，也是美国最大的尾气污染制造者。【原文：It might seem like U.S. President-elect Donald Trump’s plan to gut automotive emissions restrictions and fuel-efficiency standards would be a boon to General Motors , America’s leading purveyor of full-sized trucks and SUVs and its biggest tailpipe polluter.】

item.title: 2025 年前景不明，各国央行 11 月延长宽松周期
item.description: 11 月份，发达经济体和新兴经济体央行的宽松货币政策稳步推进，而市场则在为新的一年做好准备，因为新的一年可能会给全球政策制定背景带来结构性变化。【原文：Monetary easing by central banks across developed and emerging economies trundled along in November with markets warily gearing up for a new year that could bring tectonic shifts to the global policy making backdrop.】

item.title: 期货韬光养晦，关注更多数据和美联储评论
item.description: 在上一交易日 S&P 指数和纳斯达克指数创下历史新高后，周二美国股指期货表现平淡，市场关注本周晚些时候的一份重要就业报告以及美联储官员的更多数据和评论。【原文：U.S. stock index futures were muted on Tuesday after the S&P and the Nasdaq notched record high levels in the last session, with focus on a crucial jobs report later this week along with more data and commentary from Federal Reserve officials.】

item.title: StanChart 高管表示，美国关税迫在眉睫，全球化正在 "重置"。
item.description: 渣打银行（Standard Chartered）一位高级管理人员周二在伦敦举行的一次银行业会议上表示，由于美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）威胁要征收贸易关税，全球化正在 "重启"。【原文：Globalisation is being "reset", as U.S. President-elect Donald Trump threatens trade tariffs, a senior Standard Chartered executive told a banking conference in London on Tuesday.】

item.title: 中国互联网协会：中国企业应实现芯片来源多元化
item.description: 中国互联网协会（ISC）官方微信账号周二呼吁国内企业慎重考虑采购美国芯片，并寻求扩大与其他国家和地区芯片公司的合作。【原文：The Internet Society of China (ISC) urged domestic companies on Tuesday to carefully consider the procurement of U.S. chips and seek to expand cooperation with chip firms from other countries and regions, according to its official WeChat account.】

item.title: 印尼有望在一周内获得苹果公司 10 亿美元的投资承诺
item.description: 印尼投资部长周二表示，印尼有望在一周内获得科技公司苹果公司 10 亿美元的投资承诺，在此之前，印尼政府禁止销售 iPhone 16，原因是苹果公司未能满足当地含量规定。【原文：Indonesia is expecting to get a $1 billion investment commitment from tech firm Apple Inc in a week, its investment minister said on Tuesday, after the government banned iPhone 16 sales for failing to meet local content rules.】

item.title: 独家报道文件显示，俄罗斯批准向当地商人出售嘉士伯 3.2 亿美元资产
item.description: 路透社看到的一份政府文件显示，俄罗斯政府已批准以 340 亿卢布（约合 3.2075 亿美元）的价格将丹麦啤酒制造商嘉士伯在俄罗斯的资产出售给一家与啤酒厂控股公司有关联的当地公司 VG Invest。【原文：Russia's government has approved the sale of Danish brewer Carlsberg's assets in Russia to VG Invest, a local firm with links to brewery holdings, for 34 billion roubles ($320.75 million), a government document seen by Reuters showed.】

item.title: StanChart 目标未来五年新增 2,000 亿美元财富资产
item.description: 渣打银行（Standard Chartered）周二表示，作为向高收费业务转型的更广泛战略的一部分，该行未来五年的目标是新增资产 2,000 亿美元，财富业务收入实现两位数增长。【原文：Standard Chartered will target $200 billion in new assets and double digit growth in income from its wealth business over the next five years, it said on Tuesday, as part of a wider strategy to shift to higher fee-earning businesses.】

item.title: 工会称德国各地近 10 万名工人参加大众罢工
item.description: IG Metall 工会表示，近 10 万名工人周一参加了大众汽车德国工厂的罢工，抗议管理层削减工资甚至关闭这家欧洲最大汽车制造商工厂的计划，并威胁要采取进一步的工业行动。【原文：Almost 100,000 workers joined walkouts at Volkswagen's German plants on Monday in protest at management plans to cut wages and even close sites at Europe's biggest carmaker, the IG Metall union said, threatening further industrial action.】

item.title: 航天公司计划成立新的欧洲卫星合资企业，与 "星链 "对抗
item.description: 欧洲的空中客车公司、泰雷兹公司和莱昂纳多公司正在探讨成立一家新的联合太空公司的计划，他们希望与埃隆-马斯克的 "星链 "公司展开竞争。【原文：Europe's Airbus , Thales and Leonardo are exploring plans to set up a new joint space company as they look to compete with Elon Musk's Starlink.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长西波罗内：特朗普关税可能拖累欧洲经济增长和通胀
item.description: 欧洲中央银行董事会成员皮耶罗-西波隆（Piero Cipollone）周二表示，美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普政府预计将实施的进口关税可能会降低欧元区20个成员国的经济增长和通货膨胀率。【原文：Import tariffs expected to be implemented by the administration of U.S. President-elect Donald Trump could lower economic growth and inflation in the 20 nations sharing the euro, European Central Bank board member Piero Cipollone said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 特斯拉国产电动汽车 11 月销量下降 4.3
item.description: 中国乘用车联席会（CPCA）周二公布的数据显示，美国汽车制造商特斯拉11月份在中国生产的电动汽车销量同比下降4.3%，至78856辆。【原文：U.S. automaker Tesla's 's sales of China-made electric vehicles fell 4.3% year-on-year to 78,856 in November, data from the China Passenger Car Association (CPCA) showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 中国禁止向美国出口镓、锗和锑
item.description: 中国商务部表示，中国将禁止向美国出口与镓、锗、锑和超硬材料有关的 "军民两用产品"，禁令将于本周二生效。【原文：China will ban exports of 'dual-use items' related to gallium, germanium, antimony and superhard materials to the United States that take effect from Tuesday, the commerce ministry said.】
